/>
X.i.6.F.1.f
.
Scanning IDES Evidence Locally
MSCs are permitted to locally scan evidence or forms submitted by the claimant during or after the initial meeting (such as
VA Form 21-686c
, dependency documents, private medical evidence, etc.) as an alternative to sending documents to the scanning vendor.
Exception
:  Local scanning is only permitted if the local scanner has a resolution of at least 300 dots per inch (DPI).
After scanning the documents, the MSC must
review the files to confirm that all pages of the document have been properly scanned and are oriented properly
upload and index the documents in accordance with
M21-1, Part X, Subpart i, 6.F.1.h
, and
handle the original paper evidence in accordance with
M21-1, Part X, Subpart i, 6.F.1.i
.
Note
:  When documents are scanned and uploaded locally, the actions must be completed within the timeframes outlined in
M21-1, Part X, Subpart i, 6.F.1.j
.
title: M21-1, Part X, Subpart i, Chapter 6, Section F - Integrated Disability Evaluation System (IDES) Development and Examinations
citation: Part X, Subpart i, Chapter 6, Section F
